ygData.subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
ygData.msgSnippet: The tree was luck. You could ve taken me down at least a dozen times before that. You don t have the killer instinct. At least not YET. Lunarpine was worried

"The tree was luck. You could've taken me down at least a dozen times 
before that. You don't have the killer instinct. At least not YET." 
Lunarpine was worried that there was more damage done than she was 
telling him, but he didn't press the point.

Shadow Wing asked about sword training
"You could've pulled your daggers any time you wanted. There's only 
one rule I can think of in these matches. No killing the other 
maximal.

There was a breeze coming from the west. he'd worked his way east to 
keep her scent coming toward him. Now he smelled something coming 
from the east, the scent was to faint to identify.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She looked into his eyes.  She could see the fire in his spark 
> burning brightly.  She smiled and felt his hand run through her 
> feathers. "Your right. You can see just fine. And I'm fine. Shook 
up 
> a bit, but fine. Thank you."  
> 
> She transformed into bot mode and stood for a moment looking into 
his 
> eyes, his big, beautiful, golden wolf like eyes.  She shook her 
head 
> as if trying to brake a spell he had put over her.
> 
> "I ah...that was a good move you made. Felling the tree like that. 
I 
> didn't expect that one at all. I'll have to be more careful next 
> time."  she smiled warmly at him and looked again into his eyes.  
> They were almost hipnotic to her. She knew a wolf's stare was 
> supposed to be able to almost stare into the heart of a being, but 
> his stare surrounded her. She turned around and looked at the tree 
on 
> the ground. "uh, OK, what do you want to teach me next? How to 
fight 
> with swords perhaps?"
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > "Are you alright?"Lunarpine asked with more concern in his voice 
> than 
> > he'd origionally intended."Are you able to fly?"
> > 
> > He helped Shadow Wing to her feet (Talons) and checked her wing. 
> > Nothing appeared to be damaged beyond internal repair 
capabilities.
> > 
> > He looked in her great owl eyes and saw the beast she could've 
been 
> > if she wasn't a transformer. A spark which seemed to be wanting 
> > completion. He kissed the top of her beak and brushed his hand 
> > through her soft downy feathers. 
> > 
> > Unfortunately Lunarpine didn't know when to shut up."See I told 
you 
> > not to worry about my eyes." 
> >
